intro: Disemma eglandulosa, commonly known as the smoothleaf disemma, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its smooth, elliptical leaves and small, clustered white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and stream banks. Disemma eglandulosa is often found in association with other understory plants in humid, temperate regions.
